alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 1:38PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ada, southwestern Elmore and central Owyhee Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 137 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grand View, or 25 miles west of Mountain Home, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Grand View and Hinton Reservoir around 140 PM MDT. C J Strike Reservoir, C J Strike Dam and Cinder Cone Butte around 150 PM MDT. Mountain Home Air Force Base, Bruneau and Bruneau Sand Dunes around 200 PM MDT. Mountain Home around 210 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near CJ Strike Reservoir, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley
